name: strand-grid
description: A fully styled, configurable data grid with item recycling.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The array of data or strand-collection to render into the grid.

attributes.name: itemTemplate
attributes.description: A string pointing to a custom item template by ID.  Should be explicitly assigned if 'itemTemplateElement' is not.

attributes.name: itemTemplateElement
attributes.description: The custom item template DOM fragment.  Should be explicitly assigned if 'itemTemplate' is not.

attributes.name: sortField
attributes.description: Set/Get the current sort data field.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: Whether or not the grid has expanded all of its items.

attributes.name: isLoading
attributes.description: Whether or not the grid should indicate that it is globally waiting for data to load.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: The content scope that is passed to the grid's items - typically the grid itself.

attributes.name: gpu
attributes.description: Indication of which rendering method is preferred - note that '3d' rendering can have unintended clipping effects on content in the grid.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: The current first visible item's index at the top of the grid.

methods.name: createId
methods.description: Creates a unique identification string for positionable elements nested within an strand-grid. This will be necessary when using strand-menu, strand-popover, or strand-tooltip within a custom strand-grid-item (see: strand-popover, strand-tooltip, strand-menu).

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The unique string to be used to identify the element.

methods.name: setAllSelections
methods.description: Sets all of the grid's items to be selected or deselected according to the provided parameter.

arguments.name: checked
arguments.description: true selects all items and false deselects all items.

methods.name: setAllExpansions
methods.description: Sets all of the grid's items to be expanded or collapsed according to the provided parameter.

arguments.name: expanded
arguments.description: true expands all items and false collapses all items.

methods.name: sortBy
methods.description: Indicates which field/column should be sorted, and in which direction.  Invoking this method does not actually perform any sorting operations on the data, it does however fire events so that listeners may do so.

arguments.name: field
arguments.description: The name of the field on the column chosen for sorting.

arguments.name: order
arguments.description: The direction in which the data should be sorted.

methods.name: requestInitialization
methods.description: Under especially unusual circumstances, the grid may not initialize (nor render) properly.  This method can be invoked to correct any such issue.  Generally, developers should never need to call this method - however, it should be idempotent (and thus safe to call multiple times successively).
